Context:
Program Name: Construction Techniques
Code: T176
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (3 semesters)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $5,908.00
International Tuition: $26,719.00
Program Location: Casa Loma Campus
Semester 1 Courses: Electrical/Millwrighting
Semester 2 Courses: Sheet Metal/Air Conditioning/Carpentry
Semester 3 Courses: Welding/Steamfitting/Plumbing
Program Availability:
- Fall 2024: Open for both Domestic and International students
- Winter 2025: Open for both Domestic and International students (opens Apr 8, 2024)
- Spring 2025: Open for both Domestic and International students (opens Aug 6, 2024)
Related Programs: Construction Engineering Technology (T105), Building Renovation Technology (T148), Carpentry and Renovation Technician (T180)

Context:
The text provides information about a construction program offered at George Brown College. Here are some key facts and entities extracted from the text:

* The program offers both undergraduate studies and postgraduate opportunities.
* After completing the program, graduates can look for work in various sectors of the construction industry or continue their education by enrolling in one-year, two-year, or three-year programs at George Brown College.
* The construction industry is a large employer in Canada, with skilled trades workers being among the highest-paid and most in-demand employees. Ontario will need to attract over 100,000 new construction workers over the next 10 years.
* The required courses for the first semester include BLDG 1121 (Electrical Trade Shop), BLDG 1122 (Technical Drawing), BLDG 1123 (Millwright Trade Shop), BLDG 1124 (Electrical Trade Theory), BLDG 1125 (Introduction to Electrical Code and Prints), COMM 2000 (Communicating Across Contexts), and PORT 1001 (Portfolio).
* The required courses for the second semester include BLDG 1132 (Carpentry Trade Theory), BLDG 1133 (Carpentry Trade Shop), BLDG 1134 (Trade Calculations), BLDG 1135 (Refrigeration Trade Theory), BLDG 1137 (Sheet Metal Trade Theory), BLDG 1138 (Refrigeration Trade Shop), BLDG 1139 (Sheet Metal Trade Shop), and a General Education Elective.
* The program learning outcomes include the ability to identify and use strategies for professional growth, adhere to established health and safety practices, perform all construction tasks in compliance with applicable laws and regulations, work in accordance with sustainability practices, and collaborate.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Construction Techniques Program T176 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the ethical practices required in the construction field at the college, sustainability practices to be followed, collaboration with various tradespersons and project stakeholders, communication of technical information, identification and use of industry-specific technologies, problem-solving using mathematical equations and geometric concepts, safe operation of hand and power tools and equipment, assistance in preparing project estimates, labor tasks at construction sites, tuition fees for domestic and international students, financial assistance through OSAP, admission requirements including the Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English and Math (M or U), or mature student status.

Here is the extracted information:

* Ethical practices in construction field
* Sustainability practices
* Collaboration with tradespersons and project stakeholders
* Communication of technical information
* Use of industry-specific technologies
* Problem-solving using mathematical equations and geometric concepts
* Safe operation of hand and power tools and equipment
* Assistance in preparing project estimates
* Labor tasks at construction sites
* Tuition fees:
  * Domestic: $5,908 for three semesters starting Fall 2023
  * International: $26,719 for first three semesters starting Fall 2024
* Financial assistance through OSAP (for applicants who meet eligibility criteria)
* Admission requirements:
  * Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
  * Grade 12 English (C or U)
  * Grade 11 Math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U)
  * Mature students may apply.

Context:
* Mature students who are 19 years of age or older and do not have an OSSD can take the Admissions Assessment for English and Math or consider upgrading to achieve the necessary credits in English and Math.
* George Brown College offers course exemptions based on college or university credits, more information can be found on the Transfer Guide.
* International students should visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
* Contact information for the School of Apprenticeship and Skilled Trades: phone number (416-415-5000, ext. 6711), email (skilledtrades@georgebrown.ca), office location (Casa Loma Campus, Room E308).
* Applicants can contact the George Brown College Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
* International students can contact recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
* Campus visits and information sessions are available, sign up for an information session on the website.
* Related programs offered: Construction Engineering Technology (T105), Building Renovation Technology (T148), Carpentry and Renovation Technician (T180).

Context: Alicia Parrott-Barros is a student who holds an Ontario College Certificate from George Brown College. The college offers campus tours and info sessions for prospective students to visit and learn more about the programs and life at the college. Interested individuals can sign up on the website by providing their first name, last name, email address, and indicating whether they are domestic or international students. They also need to agree to receive email communications from the college.
